summary:
Rutgers, founded in 1766 as Queen's College, is one of the oldest universities in the U.S. and New Jersey's second-oldest. It was renamed after Colonel Henry Rutgers in 1825. Originally a private liberal arts college, it became a public research university in 1945.

The university has multiple campuses across New Jersey, with its main site in New Brunswick. It offers a wide range of courses and has over 65,000 students. Rutgers is known for its research and is a member of important academic associations.
title: Rutgers University
